sailing.title: Private Sailing Yachts in Phuket
sailing.description: A sailing yacht is the classic choice. You get the true feeling of sailing, a relaxed pace, and a "real boat holiday" vibe. It's perfect for couples, smaller groups, and anyone who loves the romance of sails and sea breeze.

catamaran.title: Catamaran Charters in Phuket
catamaran.description: Catamarans are all about space and comfort. They're stable, family-friendly, and great for groups who want more lounging areas, shade, and a social deck layout.

overnight.title: Overnight & Multi-Day Sailing
overnight.description: If you want the best overall experience, go overnight. You get quiet mornings at anchor, less rushing, and routes day trips simply can't reach.

cabin.title: Cabin Cruises Phuket
cabin.description: Want a multi-day sailing trip without renting a whole private boat? Cabin cruises let you book by the cabin. It's ideal for solo travelers, couples, and small groups who still want incredible island-hopping at a lower cost.

bareboat.title: Bareboat Charter Phuket
bareboat.description: For confident sailors who want full freedom. Bareboat usually requires a license and/or proven sailing experience. If you qualify, it's an amazing way to explore on your own terms.

sailingPhuket.title: Sailing Phuket
sailingPhuket.description: Phuket is one of the best sailing hubs in Southeast Asia. Distances between islands are perfect for day trips or multi-night routes. You can choose calm bays, scenic limestone landscapes, snorkeling stops, or remote anchorages that feel far from crowds.

tripType.title: What Trip Type Suits You?
tripType.subtitle: Quick guide to picking the right Sailing Phuket trip

day.title: Day Trip / Sunset Sail
day.description: Quick taste, nearby bays, snorkeling, flexible.

oneNight.title: 1 Night / 2 Days
oneNight.description: Sunset + sunrise at anchor. Wake up to quiet mornings on the water.

multiDay.title: 3–5 Nights
multiDay.description: Real island-hopping. Quiet bays, longer swims, more time to relax.

extended.title: 6–14+ Nights
extended.description: Full exploration of remote islands. Experience areas few day-trippers ever see.

overnightSailing.title: Overnight Sailing Phuket — Why It's Worth It
overnightSailing.description: Overnight trips let you escape crowded day-trip areas and experience Phuket's quieter side. Mornings at anchor, stars at night, and routes to islands that feel untouched.
overnightSailing.mornings: Wake up to calm bays before other boats arrive
overnightSailing.islands: Reach farther islands: Koh Rok, Koh Ha, Butang, Similan
overnightSailing.pace: More relaxed pace—no rushing back to port
overnightSailing.experience: Better snorkeling, fewer crowds, more memorable experiences

recommendation.title: Our Recommendation
recommendation.description: If you can, book at least 5 nights. That's the sweet spot for covering Phuket's best southern islands without feeling rushed.

catamaranVsSailing.title: Catamaran vs Sailing Yacht in Phuket
catamaranVsSailing.subtitle: Not sure which to pick? Both are great, but they suit different preferences.
catamaranVsSailing.conclusion: Still unsure? Tell us your group size, travel style, and dates—we'll recommend the best boat type for you.

bestTime.question: What is the best time for Sailing Phuket?
bestTime.answer: Most guests prefer calmer, drier months, but Phuket can work year-round with the right route choices. We'll recommend the best itinerary for your exact dates.

catamaranVsSailing.question: Is a catamaran better than a sailing yacht?
catamaranVsSailing.answer: Catamarans offer more space and stability. Sailing yachts feel more classic. The best choice depends on your group size and preferences.

recommendedNights.question: How many nights do you recommend?
recommendedNights.answer: If possible, we recommend 5 nights minimum to reach quieter areas like Koh Rok and Koh Ha.

familyFriendly.question: Are trips family-friendly?
familyFriendly.answer: Yes. We recommend stable boats, calm swim stops, and family-friendly routes.

romantic.question: Is it good for couples?
romantic.answer: Absolutely. Couples love sunset sails and overnight anchorages for privacy and atmosphere.
